# Setting up connection (in `RSQLite`)

This chunk of code will take the in-memory data and allow this data to be queried exactly like a SQL database. 

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(DBI)
library(tidyverse)
# Create an ephemeral in-memory RSQLite database
con = dbConnect(RSQLite::SQLite(), ":memory:")
# tbl = tibble(
#   numbers = 1:5, 
#   letters = letters[1:5])
dbListTables(con)

# dbWriteTable(con, "tbl", tbl)
# dbListTables(con)
# dbListFields(con, "tbl")
```


# Creating a table

```{sql, connection=con}
/*Creating a table called tbl, with the columns numbers and letters*/

CREATE TABLE tbl (
  numbers INT, 
  letters VARCHAR(10)
);
```

```{sql, connection=con}
INSERT INTO tbl
 (numbers, letters)
VALUES
 (1, "A"),
 (2, "B"),
 (3, "C");
```

```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl;
```

# Inserting rows

```{sql, connection=con}
INSERT INTO tbl
 (numbers, letters)
VALUES
 (4, "D");
```

```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl;
```

# Editing rows

```{sql, connection=con}
UPDATE tbl
SET 
  letters = 'Unknown'
WHERE 
  numbers IN (2, 3)
```

```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl;
```

# Deleting rows

```{sql, connection=con}
DELETE FROM tbl WHERE letters = 'Unknown'
```

```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl;
```

# Adding a new column

This initiates a new column. 

```{sql, connection=con}
ALTER TABLE tbl
  ADD n2 DECIMAL (10, 2);
```
```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl
```
`UPDATE...SET...` allows one to set values for the columns.

```{sql, connection=con}
UPDATE tbl 
SET n2 = numbers;
```

```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl
```

The updates can also be conditionals. 

```{sql, connection=con}
UPDATE tbl 
SET n2 = numbers * 2
WHERE letters = 'A';
```

```{sql, connection=con}
SELECT *
FROM tbl
```

# Enforcing uniqueness in the columns

This is most common when we have an ID column where duplicates are not allowed. 

```{sql, connection=con}
CREATE TABLE uniquetbl (
  ID INT NOT NULL UNIQUE, 
  letters VARCHAR(10)
);
```

```{sql, connection=con}
/* This works */
INSERT INTO uniquetbl
 (ID, letters)
VALUES
 (1, "A"),
 (2, "B"),
 (3, "C");
```

```{sql, connection=con, error=TRUE}
/* But this will create an error */
INSERT INTO uniquetbl
 (ID, letters)
VALUES
 (1, "D");
```
